required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Trial Of Maraviroc Versus Emtricitabine/Tenofovir Both With Darunavir/Ritonavir In Antiretroviral-Naive Patients Infected With CCR5 Tropic HIV 1
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double‑Blind, Comparative Trial Of Maraviroc + Darunavir/Ritonavir Versus Emtricitabine/Tenofovir + Darunavir/Ritonavir For The Treatment Of Antiretroviral‑Naive Hiv‑Infected Patients With Ccr5‑Tropic Hiv‑1

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess whether maraviroc administered once daily is non-inferior to emtricitabine/tenofovir also administered once daily each in combination with darunavir/ritonavir in the treatment of antiretroviral-naive patients as evaluated at Week 48 of treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: The study was terminated on October 8, 2013 following a preliminary review of the Week 48 primary efficacy data by the study's external independent Data Monitoring Committee (DMC). The DMC assessed the data as demonstrating significant differences between the treatment arms in virologic responses and failures. The DMC recommended and the Sponsor concurred that the study be terminated because of the inferior efficacy of the Maraviroc arm as compared to the comparator arm (Emtricitabine/Tenofovir).

clinical_study.why_stopped: See termination reason in detailed description.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Plasma HIV-1 RNA <50 Copies/mL.
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of participants who achieved HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL at week 48 was assessed according to Food and Drug Administration's (FDA's) Missing, Switch, Discontinuation'=Failure (MSDF) Snapshot algorithm. The algorithm used the plasma HIV-1 RNA in the Week 48 visit window, followed the "virology-first principle" and considers a participant who has a missing plasma HIV-1 RNA, or switches to prohibited ARV regimen or discontinues from the study or study drug for any reason, or dies, as a failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of Adverse Events (AE).
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with treatment-emergent non serious AEs

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 AEs
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with grade 3 or 4 AEs are presented here.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Discontinued Due to AEs
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who discontinued due to AEs are reported here. Three participants (two from the MVC+DRV/r arm and one from the FTC/TDF+DRV/r arm) were not considered as discontinued due to AE because other reasons for discontinuation were prioritized for these participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Treatment-related AEs
secondary_outcome.description: Number of treatment-related AEs are presented here.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Serious Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Total number of participants with treatment-emergent serious adverse events are reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Laboratory Values
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with laboratory abnormalities are reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Severity of Abnormal Laboratory Values
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who had clinically significant laboratory abnormalities of Grade 3 and Grade 4 according to DAIDS. Abnormality incidence of highest grade was reported for a labcode for each individual participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Relationship Between the Proportion of Participants With Plasma HIV-1 RNA <50 Copies/mL at the Week 48 and the Screening Tropism Test (Genotype Test or ESTA).
secondary_outcome.description: The relationship of the proportion of participants achieving HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL at Week 48 with the screening tropism test for the MVC containing regimen was analyzed. Virologic response for a participant at Week 48 was derived using the FDA's Snapshot MSDF algorithm. Difference in proportions of patients with plasma HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL at week 48 between the maraviroc and the emtricitabine/tenofovir treatment arms, with two-sided 95% confidence interval, among patients who are R5 by genotype (including some who were originally randomized to ESTA and are R5 by genotype upon retesting), were calculated via the Maximum Likelihood method. The estimate was adjusted for the screening plasma HIV RNA level (<100,000 vs. ≥100,000) copies/mL via the Mantel Haenszel (MH) method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Virologic Outcomes at Week 48 Using Protocol-Defined Treatment Failure (PDTF).
secondary_outcome.description: Per the protocol participants who meet the following criteria were regarded as PDTFs requiring a confirmatory plasma HIV-1 RNA determination: • Decrease in plasma HIV-1 RNA <1 log10 from baseline after Week 4 unless plasma HIV-1 RNA is <50 copies/mL, or • Plasma HIV-1 RNA >1.0 log10 above the nadir value after Week 4 where the nadir is the lowest plasma HIV-1 RNA concentration, or • Plasma HIV-1 RNA ≥50 copies/mL at any time after Week 24, or • Plasma HIV-1 RNA ≥50 copies/mL after suppression to <50 copies/mL on two consecutive visits, or • Decrease in plasma HIV-1 RNA ≤2 log10 from baseline on or after Week 12 unless plasma HIV-1 RNA is <400 copies/mL. Decrease in plasma HIV-1 RNA ≤2 log10 from baseline on or after Week 12 unless plasma HIV-1 RNA is <50 copies/mL (before August 30 2012) or <400 copies/mL (after August 30 2012).

secondary_outcome.measure: Tropism Change Between Screening or Baseline and PDTF
secondary_outcome.description: For participants meeting the PDTF criteria, tropism was assessed using the original randomized and alternate assays (ie, both genotype testing and ESTA). Data reported here corresponds to the timepoint at or after PDTF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Viral Resistance to Maraviroc (Maraviroc Treated Participants Only) in Participants Meeting PDTF Criteria.
secondary_outcome.description: For participants meeting the PDTF criteria, viral resistance to maraviroc for maraviroc treated participants was assessed in patients with R5 virus at failure. The resistance level is calculated by reference to a laboratory strain of virus that is analyzed in parallel with the clinical isolate to identify 50% inhibitory concentrations (IC50). The maximal percent inhibition is the percent inhibition that is achieved in a titration of the drug at high concentrations when the addition of more drug does not result in increased inhibition. Maximal percent inhibition is obtained in the same way as the titration for IC50, but the key measure is of the plateau height of percent inhibition, where increased concentration of maraviroc does not result in additional inhibition. This is consistent with the virus developing some ability to use maraviroc-bound CCR5 for entry. A significant change in IC50 is not required for this mechanism.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Resistance to Nucleoside/Nucleotide Reverse Transcriptase Inhibitors (NRTI), Non-nucleoside Reverse Transcriptase Inhibitors (NNRTI), and Protease Inhibitors (PI) in Participants Meeting PDTF Criteria
secondary_outcome.description: For participants meeting the PDTF criteria, viral resistance (both genotypic and phenotypic) to NRTI, NNRTI, and PI's were assessed at Baseline and on-treatment. The assessment was performed using the overall (i.e. net) susceptibility score provided using the PhenoSense GT assay. The number of participants with successful assessments were 15/17 for the MVC+DRV/r arm and 3/3 for the FTC/TDF+DRV/r arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Immune Cell Function at Week 48: Lymphocyte Marker Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4, Cell/mm^3)
secondary_outcome.description: The differences in the magnitude of changes in CD4+ at Baseline and at Week 48 for maraviroc versus emtricitabine/tenofovir were compared.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Immune Cell Function at Week 48: Lymphocyte Activation Marker CD4 (%)
secondary_outcome.description: The differences in the magnitude of changes in CD4+ from Baseline through Week 48 for maraviroc versus emtricitabine/tenofovir were compared.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Immune Cell Function at Week 48: Lymphocyte Marker Cluster of Differentiation 8 (CD8, Cell/mm^3)
secondary_outcome.description: The differences in the magnitude of changes in CD8+ cell counts from baseline through Week 48 for maraviroc versus emtricitabine/tenofovir were compared.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Immune Cell Function at Week 48: Lymphocyte Activation Marker CD8 (%)
secondary_outcome.description: The differences in the magnitude of changes in CD8+ cell counts from Baseline through Week 48 for maraviroc versus emtricitabine/tenofovir were compared.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change in CD4+/CD8+ Ratio From Baseline to Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: The differences in the magnitude of changes in CD4+/CD8+ ratio from Baseline through Weeks 48 for maraviroc versus emtricitabine/tenofovir were compared.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Peripheral Fat Distribution Using Dual Energy X-ray Absorptiometry [DEXA] Scan From Baseline and at Week 48.
secondary_outcome.description: A sub-study was conducted in which the participants underwent whole-body DEXA scans to evaluate peripheral fat tissue estimates for left and right arms and legs and truncal fat mass and truncal lean mass. Truncal abdominal fat were estimated from the DEXA scan field set on the torso. The effects on estimates of fat mass and lean mass were addressed by providing LSMs of change from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Trunk to Limb Fat Distribution Using DEXA Scan From Baseline and at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: A sub-study was conducted in which the participants underwent whole-body DEXA scans to evaluate peripheral fat tissue estimates for left and right arms and legs and truncal fat mass and truncal lean mass. Truncal abdominal fat were estimated from the DEXA scan field set on the torso. The effects on estimates of fat mass and lean mass were addressed by providing LSMs of change from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Bone Mineral Density (Using DEXA Scan and Serum Markers) From Baseline and at Week 48 - Total Hip BMD
secondary_outcome.description: Bone mineral density was evaluated by DEXA scan in a subset of participants who consented to these evaluations. The effects on BMD were addressed by providing LSMs of change from baseline bone mineral density of the lumbar spine (L1-L4), left total hip and femoral neck as measured by the DEXA scan.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Bone Mineral Density (Using DEXA Scan and Serum Markers) From Baseline and at Week 48 - Femoral Neck BMD
secondary_outcome.description: Bone mineral density was evaluated by DEXA scan in a subset of participants who consented to these evaluations. The effects on BMD were addressed by providing LSMs of change from Baseline bone mineral density femoral neck as measured by the DEXA scan.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Bone Mineral Density (Using DEXA Scan and Serum Markers) From Baseline and at Week 48 - AP Lumbar Spine (L1 - L4) BMD
secondary_outcome.description: Bone mineral density was evaluated by DEXA scan in a subset of participants who consented to these evaluations. The effects on BMD were addressed by providing LSMs of change from baseline bone mineral density of the lumbar spine (L1-L4) as measured by the DEXA scan.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Bone Turnover Markers From Baseline and at Week 48 - Blood Osteocalcin
secondary_outcome.description: Bone turnover marker, osteocalcin, was collected in the subset of participants participating in the DEXA scan sub-study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Bone Turnover Markers From Baseline and at Week 48 - Type 1 Collagen Peptide (CTX-1)
secondary_outcome.description: Bone turnover marker, C-telopeptide of type 1 collagen (CTx), was collected in the subset of participants participating in the DEXA scan sub-study.

arm_group.description: Maraviroc 150 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for emtricitabine/tenofovir once daily.
Emtricitabine/tenofovir 200/300 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for maraviroc once daily.

intervention.description: Maraviroc tablet 150 mg once daily for 96 weeks.
Emtricitabine/tenofovir tablet 200/300 mg once daily for 96 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Plasma HIV-1 RNA equal to or greater than 1,000 copies/mL measured at the Screening Visit.
- CD4 count equal to or greater than 100 cells/mm3 at Screening.
- Have only R5 HIV 1 at Screening as verified by a randomized tropism assay.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior treatment with any other HIV antiretroviral therapy for more than 14 days at any time.
- Any evidence of genotypic/phenotypic resistance to darunavir, tenofovir, and emtricitabine.
- CXCR4 using virus detected using randomized tropism determination or repeated failure to obtain an interpretable tropism result.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Emtricitabine, Tenofovir Disoproxil Fumarate Drug Combination

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Overall, 1423 participants were screened and 813 participants randomized in the study. A total of 797 participants were treated (396 were treated in the maraviroc + darunavir/ritonavir [MVC+DRV/r] group and 401 in the emtricitabine/tenofovir + darunavir/ritonavir [FTC/TDF+DRV/r] group). The study was conducted in 138 sites in 18 countries.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants were randomized to undergo either genotype testing or enhanced Trofile assay (ESTA) in a 1:1 ratio. Among participants who were identified as being infected with R5 tropic HIV-1 by either testing methods, 813 were randomized in a 1:1 ratio to receive 96-week treatment either in the MVC+DRV/r arm or in the FTC/TDF+DRV/r arm.

group.title: MVC+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of Maraviroc 150 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for emtricitabine/tenofovir once daily.

group.title: FTC/TDF+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of emtricitabine/tenofovir 200/300 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for maraviroc once daily.

group.title: MVC+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of Maraviroc 150 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for emtricitabine/tenofovir once daily.

group.title: FTC/TDF+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of emtricitabine/tenofovir 200/300 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for maraviroc once daily.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Plasma HIV-1 RNA <50 Copies/mL.
outcome.description: The proportion of participants who achieved HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL at week 48 was assessed according to Food and Drug Administration’s (FDA’s) Missing, Switch, Discontinuation’=Failure (MSDF) Snapshot algorithm. The algorithm used the plasma HIV-1 RNA in the Week 48 visit window, followed the “virology-first principle” and considers a participant who has a missing plasma HIV-1 RNA, or switches to prohibited ARV regimen or discontinues from the study or study drug for any reason, or dies, as a failure.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) consisted of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug. The missing value was imputed per FDA’s MSDF Snapshot algorithm as described under “Outcome Measure Description” above.

group.title: MVC+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of Maraviroc 150 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for emtricitabine/tenofovir once daily.

group.title: FTC/TDF+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of emtricitabine/tenofovir 200/300 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for maraviroc once daily.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Plasma HIV-1 RNA <50 Copies/mL.
measure.description: The proportion of participants who achieved HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL at week 48 was assessed according to Food and Drug Administration’s (FDA’s) Missing, Switch, Discontinuation’=Failure (MSDF) Snapshot algorithm. The algorithm used the plasma HIV-1 RNA in the Week 48 visit window, followed the “virology-first principle” and considers a participant who has a missing plasma HIV-1 RNA, or switches to prohibited ARV regimen or discontinues from the study or study drug for any reason, or dies, as a failure.
measure.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) consisted of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug. The missing value was imputed per FDA’s MSDF Snapshot algorithm as described under “Outcome Measure Description” above.

analysis.groups_desc: The difference in the percentages between the maraviroc and the emtricitabine/tenofovir treatment arms and the 2-sided 95% confidence interval for the difference was provided using the stratum-adjusted Mantel-Haenszel (MH) method over the two assays and the screening plasma HIV-1 RNA levels (>=100,000 copies/mL or <100,000 copies/mL). The sample size was chosen to yield a power of ≥90%. The 95% CIs and mean difference (final values) are presented as percentages above.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: For the analysis of the primary endpoint conducted at Week 48, the alternative hypothesis was to test for non-inferiority of MVC+DRV/r to FTC/TDF+DRV/r with a non-inferiority margin of -10%.

outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set was the same as the FAS consisting of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug but analyzed as realized for tropism assay and treatment.

outcome.title: The Relationship Between the Proportion of Participants With Plasma HIV-1 RNA <50 Copies/mL at the Week 48 and the Screening Tropism Test (Genotype Test or ESTA).
outcome.description: The relationship of the proportion of participants achieving HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL at Week 48 with the screening tropism test for the MVC containing regimen was analyzed. Virologic response for a participant at Week 48 was derived using the FDA’s Snapshot MSDF algorithm. Difference in proportions of patients with plasma HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL at week 48 between the maraviroc and the emtricitabine/tenofovir treatment arms, with two-sided 95% confidence interval, among patients who are R5 by genotype (including some who were originally randomized to ESTA and are R5 by genotype upon retesting), were calculated via the Maximum Likelihood method. The estimate was adjusted for the screening plasma HIV RNA level (<100,000 vs. ≥100,000) copies/mL via the Mantel Haenszel (MH) method.
outcome.population: The FAS consisted of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug.

Difference in proportions of patients with plasma HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL at week 48 between the maraviroc and the emtricitabine/tenofovir treatment arms, with two-sided 95% confidence interval, among patients who are R5 by genotype (including some who were originally randomized to ESTA and are R5 by genotype upon retesting), were calculated via the Maximum Likelihood method. The estimate was adjusted for the screening plasma HIV RNA level (<100,000 vs. ≥100,000) copies/mL via the Mantel Haenszel (MH) method.
measure.population: The FAS consisted of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug.

analysis.groups_desc: The difference in proportions of patients with plasma HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL at Week 48 between the [MVC+DRV/r] and the [FTC/TDF+DRV/r] treatment arms, with two-sided 95% confidence interval, is shown for those patients who were R5 by genotype (including all who were originally randomized to ESTA and were R5 by genotype upon retesting), via the maximum likelihood (ML) method.

outcome.title: Virologic Outcomes at Week 48 Using Protocol-Defined Treatment Failure (PDTF).
outcome.description: Per the protocol participants who meet the following criteria were regarded as PDTFs requiring a confirmatory plasma HIV-1 RNA determination: • Decrease in plasma HIV-1 RNA <1 log10 from baseline after Week 4 unless plasma HIV-1 RNA is <50 copies/mL, or • Plasma HIV-1 RNA >1.0 log10 above the nadir value after Week 4 where the nadir is the lowest plasma HIV-1 RNA concentration, or • Plasma HIV-1 RNA ≥50 copies/mL at any time after Week 24, or • Plasma HIV-1 RNA ≥50 copies/mL after suppression to <50 copies/mL on two consecutive visits, or • Decrease in plasma HIV-1 RNA ≤2 log10 from baseline on or after Week 12 unless plasma HIV-1 RNA is <400 copies/mL. Decrease in plasma HIV-1 RNA ≤2 log10 from baseline on or after Week 12 unless plasma HIV-1 RNA is <50 copies/mL (before August 30 2012) or <400 copies/mL (after August 30 2012).
outcome.population: The FAS consisted of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug. No imputation for missing values was performed for this endpoint. 'Evaluability' is determined by the on-treatment viral load (≥400 copies/mL at sample time point).

group.title: MVC+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of Maraviroc 150 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for emtricitabine/tenofovir once daily.

group.title: FTC/TDF+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of emtricitabine/tenofovir 200/300 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for maraviroc once daily.

measure.title: Virologic Outcomes at Week 48 Using Protocol-Defined Treatment Failure (PDTF).
measure.description: Per the protocol participants who meet the following criteria were regarded as PDTFs requiring a confirmatory plasma HIV-1 RNA determination: • Decrease in plasma HIV-1 RNA <1 log10 from baseline after Week 4 unless plasma HIV-1 RNA is <50 copies/mL, or • Plasma HIV-1 RNA >1.0 log10 above the nadir value after Week 4 where the nadir is the lowest plasma HIV-1 RNA concentration, or • Plasma HIV-1 RNA ≥50 copies/mL at any time after Week 24, or • Plasma HIV-1 RNA ≥50 copies/mL after suppression to <50 copies/mL on two consecutive visits, or • Decrease in plasma HIV-1 RNA ≤2 log10 from baseline on or after Week 12 unless plasma HIV-1 RNA is <400 copies/mL. Decrease in plasma HIV-1 RNA ≤2 log10 from baseline on or after Week 12 unless plasma HIV-1 RNA is <50 copies/mL (before August 30 2012) or <400 copies/mL (after August 30 2012).
measure.population: The FAS consisted of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug. No imputation for missing values was performed for this endpoint. 'Evaluability' is determined by the on-treatment viral load (≥400 copies/mL at sample time point).

outcome.title: Tropism Change Between Screening or Baseline and PDTF
outcome.description: For participants meeting the PDTF criteria, tropism was assessed using the original randomized and alternate assays (ie, both genotype testing and ESTA). Data reported here corresponds to the timepoint at or after PDTF.
outcome.population: Number of Evaluable PDTF = Virology Analysis Population (VAP) 'Evaluability' is determined by the on-treatment viral load (≥400 copies/mL at sample time point).

group.title: MVC+DRV/r - Baseline
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of Maraviroc 150 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for emtricitabine/tenofovir once daily. Summary of tropism results by baseline.

group.title: MVC+DRV/r - Failure
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of Maraviroc 150 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for emtricitabine/tenofovir once daily. Summary of tropism results corresponding to timepoint at or after PDTF.

group.title: FTC/TDF+DRV/r - Baseline
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of emtricitabine/tenofovir 200/300 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for maraviroc once daily. Summary of tropism results by baseline.

group.title: FTC/TDF+DRV/r - Failure
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of emtricitabine/tenofovir 200/300 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for maraviroc once daily. Summary of tropism results corresponding to timepoint at or after PDTF.

measure.title: Tropism Change Between Screening or Baseline and PDTF
measure.description: For participants meeting the PDTF criteria, tropism was assessed using the original randomized and alternate assays (ie, both genotype testing and ESTA). Data reported here corresponds to the timepoint at or after PDTF.
measure.population: Number of Evaluable PDTF = Virology Analysis Population (VAP) 'Evaluability' is determined by the on-treatment viral load (≥400 copies/mL at sample time point).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Viral Resistance to Maraviroc (Maraviroc Treated Participants Only) in Participants Meeting PDTF Criteria.
outcome.description: For participants meeting the PDTF criteria, viral resistance to maraviroc for maraviroc treated participants was assessed in patients with R5 virus at failure. The resistance level is calculated by reference to a laboratory strain of virus that is analyzed in parallel with the clinical isolate to identify 50% inhibitory concentrations (IC50). The maximal percent inhibition is the percent inhibition that is achieved in a titration of the drug at high concentrations when the addition of more drug does not result in increased inhibition. Maximal percent inhibition is obtained in the same way as the titration for IC50, but the key measure is of the plateau height of percent inhibition, where increased concentration of maraviroc does not result in additional inhibition. This is consistent with the virus developing some ability to use maraviroc-bound CCR5 for entry. A significant change in IC50 is not required for this mechanism.
outcome.population: The FAS consisted of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug.

group.title: MVC+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of Maraviroc 150 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for emtricitabine/tenofovir once daily.

group.title: FTC/TDF+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of emtricitabine/tenofovir 200/300 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for maraviroc once daily.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Viral Resistance to Maraviroc (Maraviroc Treated Participants Only) in Participants Meeting PDTF Criteria.
measure.description: For participants meeting the PDTF criteria, viral resistance to maraviroc for maraviroc treated participants was assessed in patients with R5 virus at failure. The resistance level is calculated by reference to a laboratory strain of virus that is analyzed in parallel with the clinical isolate to identify 50% inhibitory concentrations (IC50). The maximal percent inhibition is the percent inhibition that is achieved in a titration of the drug at high concentrations when the addition of more drug does not result in increased inhibition. Maximal percent inhibition is obtained in the same way as the titration for IC50, but the key measure is of the plateau height of percent inhibition, where increased concentration of maraviroc does not result in additional inhibition. This is consistent with the virus developing some ability to use maraviroc-bound CCR5 for entry. A significant change in IC50 is not required for this mechanism.
measure.population: The FAS consisted of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug.

class.title: Not eligible for analysis (failed tropism test)
Eligible for analysis (R5 virus using ESTA)

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Resistance to Nucleoside/Nucleotide Reverse Transcriptase Inhibitors (NRTI), Non-nucleoside Reverse Transcriptase Inhibitors (NNRTI), and Protease Inhibitors (PI) in Participants Meeting PDTF Criteria
outcome.description: For participants meeting the PDTF criteria, viral resistance (both genotypic and phenotypic) to NRTI, NNRTI, and PI’s were assessed at Baseline and on-treatment. The assessment was performed using the overall (i.e. net) susceptibility score provided using the PhenoSense GT assay. The number of participants with successful assessments were 15/17 for the MVC+DRV/r arm and 3/3 for the FTC/TDF+DRV/r arm.
outcome.population: The FAS consisted of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug. The assessment was performed using the overall (ie. net) susceptibility score provided using the PhenoSense GT assay. The number of participants with successful assessments were 15 for the MVC+DRV/r arm and 3 for the FTC/TDF+DRV/r arm.

group.title: MVC+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of Maraviroc 150 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for emtricitabine/tenofovir once daily.

group.title: FTC/TDF+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of emtricitabine/tenofovir 200/300 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for maraviroc once daily.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Resistance to Nucleoside/Nucleotide Reverse Transcriptase Inhibitors (NRTI), Non-nucleoside Reverse Transcriptase Inhibitors (NNRTI), and Protease Inhibitors (PI) in Participants Meeting PDTF Criteria
measure.description: For participants meeting the PDTF criteria, viral resistance (both genotypic and phenotypic) to NRTI, NNRTI, and PI’s were assessed at Baseline and on-treatment. The assessment was performed using the overall (i.e. net) susceptibility score provided using the PhenoSense GT assay. The number of participants with successful assessments were 15/17 for the MVC+DRV/r arm and 3/3 for the FTC/TDF+DRV/r arm.
measure.population: The FAS consisted of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug. The assessment was performed using the overall (ie. net) susceptibility score provided using the PhenoSense GT assay. The number of participants with successful assessments were 15 for the MVC+DRV/r arm and 3 for the FTC/TDF+DRV/r arm.

outcome.title: Absolute Change From Baseline in Immune Cell Function at Week 48: Lymphocyte Marker Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4, Cell/mm^3)
outcome.description: The differences in the magnitude of changes in CD4+ at Baseline and at Week 48 for maraviroc versus emtricitabine/tenofovir were compared.
outcome.population: The FAS consisted of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug. Missing values were imputed using LOCF approach. Baseline was calculated as the average of all the pre-dose measurements excluding the screening value. If all pre-dose values were missing, screening value was considered as the baseline.

group.title: MVC+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of Maraviroc 150 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for emtricitabine/tenofovir once daily.

group.title: FTC/TDF+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of emtricitabine/tenofovir 200/300 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for maraviroc once daily.

measure.title: Absolute Change From Baseline in Immune Cell Function at Week 48: Lymphocyte Marker Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4, Cell/mm^3)
measure.description: The differences in the magnitude of changes in CD4+ at Baseline and at Week 48 for maraviroc versus emtricitabine/tenofovir were compared.
measure.population: The FAS consisted of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug. Missing values were imputed using LOCF approach. Baseline was calculated as the average of all the pre-dose measurements excluding the screening value. If all pre-dose values were missing, screening value was considered as the baseline.

analysis.groups_desc: Results were from an ANCOVA model with change from Baseline as the response variable and the following fixed effect model terms: Treatment group, Screening plasma HIV RNA concentration, Screening Tropism Assay, Baseline value of the response variable.

outcome.title: Changes in Peripheral Fat Distribution Using Dual Energy X-ray Absorptiometry [DEXA] Scan From Baseline and at Week 48.
outcome.description: A sub-study was conducted in which the participants underwent whole-body DEXA scans to evaluate peripheral fat tissue estimates for left and right arms and legs and truncal fat mass and truncal lean mass. Truncal abdominal fat were estimated from the DEXA scan field set on the torso. The effects on estimates of fat mass and lean mass were addressed by providing LSMs of change from baseline.
outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set was the same as the FAS consisting of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug but analyzed as realized for tropism assay and treatment. Missing values were imputed using LOCF approach.

group.title: MVC+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of Maraviroc 150 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for emtricitabine/tenofovir once daily.

analysis.groups_desc: Results are from ANCOVA model with change from Baseline as the response variable and the following fixed effect model terms: treatment group, age, race, Screening BMI, and Baseline value of the response variable. Treatment differences are estimated using LS means with factor levels weighted according to overall analysis population proportions.

outcome.title: Changes in Bone Mineral Density (Using DEXA Scan and Serum Markers) From Baseline and at Week 48 - Total Hip BMD
outcome.description: Bone mineral density was evaluated by DEXA scan in a subset of participants who consented to these evaluations. The effects on BMD were addressed by providing LSMs of change from baseline bone mineral density of the lumbar spine (L1-L4), left total hip and femoral neck as measured by the DEXA scan.
outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set was the same as the FAS consisting of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug but analyzed as realized for tropism assay and treatment. Missing values were imputed using LOCF approach.

measure.title: Change in Bone Turnover Markers From Baseline and at Week 48 - Blood Osteocalcin
measure.description: Bone turnover marker, osteocalcin, was collected in the subset of participants participating in the DEXA scan sub-study.
measure.population: Safety Analysis Set was the same as the FAS consisting of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug but analyzed as realized for tropism assay and treatment. Missing values were imputed using LOCF approach.

analysis.groups_desc: Results are from ANCOVA model with change from Baseline as the response variable and the following fixed effect model terms: treatment group, age, race, Screening BMI, and Baseline value of the response variable. Treatment differences are estimated using LS means with factor levels weighted according to overall analysis population proportions.

outcome.title: Change in Bone Turnover Markers From Baseline and at Week 48 - Type 1 Collagen Peptide (CTX-1)
outcome.description: Bone turnover marker, C-telopeptide of type 1 collagen (CTx), was collected in the subset of participants participating in the DEXA scan sub-study.
outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set was the same as the FAS consisting of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug but analyzed as realized for tropism assay and treatment. Missing values were imputed using LOCF approach.

group.title: MVC+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of Maraviroc 150 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for emtricitabine/tenofovir once daily.

group.title: FTC/TDF+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of emtricitabine/tenofovir 200/300 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for maraviroc once daily.

measure.title: Change in Bone Turnover Markers From Baseline and at Week 48 - Type 1 Collagen Peptide (CTX-1)
measure.description: Bone turnover marker, C-telopeptide of type 1 collagen (CTx), was collected in the subset of participants participating in the DEXA scan sub-study.
measure.population: Safety Analysis Set was the same as the FAS consisting of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of the study drug but analyzed as realized for tropism assay and treatment. Missing values were imputed using LOCF approach.

analysis.groups_desc: Results are from an ANCOVA model with change from Baseline as the response variable and the following fixed effect model terms: treatment group, age, race, Screening BMI, Baseline value of the response variable. Treatment differences are estimated using LS means with factor levels weighted according to overall analysis population proportions.

reported_events.time_frame: From the day the first dose of the study drug was administered to 28 days after the last dose of the study drug was administered.
reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one participant and as nonserious in another participant, or one participant may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: MVC+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of Maraviroc 150 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for emtricitabine/tenofovir once daily.

group.title: FTC/TDF+DRV/r
group.description: Participants infected with R5 HIV-1 received oral tablets of emtricitabine/tenofovir 200/300 mg once daily plus darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg once daily plus placebo for maraviroc once daily.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The study was terminated following a preliminary review of the 48- week primary clinical efficacy data by the study’s external independent Data Monitoring Committee’s recommendation based on inferior efficacy of the investigational MVC+DRV/r arm.
